title: In-game VOIP
body:
I remember back when I played EvE Online they implemented an in-game VOIP service. I've only been playing League less than a year, but has this ever been something that Riot has considered adding into the game? And how about a Ranked system for people ages 18+? Maybe verify age through credit card purchases? Oh, I know it'll never happen, but I can always dream. You can't stop me from dreaming. 

{{summoner:3}}

replies.body: I really hope they never implement a built in voice chat. People would stop using pings and I wouldn't be able to keep /mute all on every game. Chat is already annoying enough in text, I don't even want to imagine it in voice.

*nasally voice* oh my god you ***** *****'s! you have to grab dragon you ********! God, I'm the only competent one on a team of *****'s! 

If you imagined it, would it sound something like that?
I'd imagine the foreigners cursing at you with broken English to be specially annoying with voice too.

I don't want it. If it's added it should be 100% optional and default to off so that only people who actually want it use it.

VOIP always has bad manners, the dude with the mic stuck open breathing heavily, the squeaker kids, the raged out nooblord. I just choose to only voice with people I know.
That's how it was in EvE Online, it was optional. You could turn it on and off, mute people, etc. I haven't seen many games with in-game VOIP.
